you are running a server install, not a normal install right ?
just installing it should do the trick, now you just have to turn up _all_ volumes, and sound should be working
if you're using gnome, you'll also want to use esound (esd) as a sound interface. That means every app should be configured to use esd, not oss or alsa
if you're using kde, you should either configure muse to use arts (the kde sound daemon), or configure arts (in kde) to release the "sound card" after 1 second if it's not being used.
